title: Breastfeeding Gets A Boost From Philadelphia Hospitals
teaser: The city's major birthing hospitals have now stopped sending new moms home with baby formula, to encourage breastfeeding.
contentencoded:
All of Philadelphia’s major birthing hospitals have now stopped giving out discharge bags filled with formula to new moms. The city joins about a quarter of hospitals nationwide in going “bag free” as part of a broader push to encourage breastfeeding.

From the Here & Now Contributors Network, Elana Gordon at WHYY’s “The Pulse” reports.

  • Read more on this story via WHYY’s “The Pulse”

Reporter

  • Elana Gordon, health and science reporter for WHYY’s “The Pulse.” She tweets @Elana_Gordon.
